# item(withTitle:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the menu item with the specified title.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func item(withTitle title: String) -> NSMenuItem?
```

## Parameters

- **title**: The title of the menu item you want.

## Return Value

The menu item, or `nil` if no item with the specified title exists in the menu.

## Related Documentation

- **itemTitle(at:)**: Returns the title of the item at the specified index.

## Accessing the items

- **itemArray**: An array of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItem] objects that represent the items in the menu.
- **numberOfItems**: The number of items in the menu.
- **index(of:)**: Returns the index of the specified menu item.
- **indexOfItem(withTitle:)**: Returns the index of the item with the specified title.
- **indexOfItem(withTag:)**: Returns the index of the menu item with the specified tag.
- **indexOfItem(withRepresentedObject:)**: Returns the index of the menu item that holds the specified represented object.
- **indexOfItem(withTarget:andAction:)**: Returns the index of the menu item with the specified target and action.
- **item(at:)**: Returns the menu item at the specified index.
- **lastItem**: The last item in the menu.
